name: google-search-ext
description: Enables Google Search from the VS Code editor.

google-search-ext.selection-mode.description: Sets how the search term is determined. The default, "cursor", uses the selection if any, or the word under/at the cursor if there is none. "selection" only uses explicit selections as search terms.

google-search-ext.interface-language.description: Sets the interface language parameter ('hl') of the Google query. Commonly a two letter code. Values list: https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results_appendices#interfaceLanguages

google-search-ext.language.description: Sets the parameter limiting results by language ('lr') of the Google query. Should be a value of the format 'lang_<2-letter-lowercase-code>', e.g. lang_de for German. Values list: https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results_appendices#languageCollections

google-search-ext.country.description: Sets the parameter limiting results by country ('cr') of the Google query. Should be a value of the format 'country<2-letter-uppercase-code>', e.g. countryFR for France. Values list: https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results_appendices#countryCollections

google-search-ext.custom-query.description: Anything that should be added to the query string of the URL. E.g. 'num=10&as_qdr=3d', which limits the number of results to 10 and sets the date range to the last three days. Documentation on available parameters: https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#wsQueryTerms
